title: Ticket #1154: Tests should know / report own description and classes
description:
Currently the description for a test is in the Imakefile, along with which classes the test is in. Further documentation is sometimes present in testmethods.txt. This is clumsy. A test should be more self contained. Perhaps each test (that is, .run file) should understand "--describe" which will return something like this: 
brief=Condor-C AB test
long=This test verifies a basic condor-c job can be submitted to A and run on B and complete.
implementation=Two condor pools are set up with dynamic address and predefined locations to read the port. Then the one configured as the A sends the job off to the B side. Expected result: job completion on the A side.
classes=condorc,quick,full,quicknolink

To generate the list_*s, you'd run --describe on each script to get the classes. To generate the *.desc files (are those used for anything?), you'd do the same. We cuold also use it to generate documentation if the urge struck us.
